The flag of Georgia alongside the flag of autonomous Adjara

The following is a list of flags of Georgia.

Contents

  • 1 National flag and State flag
  • 2 President's flag
  • 3 Military flags
  • 4 City-Town Flags
  • 5 Regional flags
  • 6 Flag of Georgian Orthodox Church
  • 7 Historical flags
  • 8 Historical Flags of Georgian States
  • 9 See also
  • 10 References
  • 11 External links

National flag and State flag[edit]

Flag Date Use Description
2004–present Civil and state flag and ensign Ratio: 2:3

President's flag[edit]

Flag Date Use Description
2005–present Flag of the President of Georgia

Military flags[edit]

Flag Date Use Description
2004–present War flag
2004–present Naval ensign
2004–present Army flag
2004–present Air force flag
2004–present Flag of the Chief of the General Staff
2004–present Flag of the Minister of Defence
2004–present Flag of the National Guard
2004–present Flag of the Georgian Intelligence Service

City-Town Flags[edit]

Flag Date Use Description
2004–present Flag of Tbilisi Flag of Tbilisi. Capital of Georgia
2004–present Flag of Kutaisi Flag of legislative city of Georgia called Kutaisi. located in region Imereti
2004–present Flag of Batumi Flag of capital of Autonomous Republic of Ajara and biggest port in Republic. City Batumi
2004–present Flag of Rustavi Flag of biggest city in region Kvemo Kartli. City Rustavi
2015–present Flag of Gori Flag of biggest city in region Shida Kartli. City Gori
2004–present Flag of Mtskheta Flag of town located in Region Mtskheta-Mtianeti
2004–present Flag of Poti Flag of second Georgian port called Poti. located in Region Samegrelo
2015–present Flag of Akhaltsikhe Flag of city located in Region Samtskhe-Javakheti
2015–present Flag of Telavi Flag of city located in Region Kakheti
2015–present Flag of Ambrolauri Flag of town located in Region Racha-Lechkhumi and Kvemo Svaneti

Regional flags[edit]

Flag Date Use Description
2004–present Flag of Adjara Used by government of Autonomous Republic of Ajara
2000–2004 Flag of Adjara Used by Pro-Adjarian independence movement during rule of Aslan Abashidze in Adjaria.
2013-present Flag used by Pro-Georgian Government of the Autonomous Republic of Abkhazia.
1992-present Flag used by the Abkhazian separatist government. Flag of Abkhazia Republic of Abkhazia.
1990-present Flag of South Ossetia, used both by the separatist government of South Ossetia and the pro-Georgian Provisional Administrative Entity of South Ossetia.

Flag of Georgian Orthodox Church[edit]

Flag Date
1991-present Flag of Georgian Orthodox Church

Historical flags[edit]

Flag Date Use Description
1990–2004 Civil and State flag and ensign Ratio: 3:5
1951–1990 Flag of Georgia SSR Red hammer and sickle with star in a blue sun in canton, blue bar in upper part of flag. Adopted 11 April 1951.
1940–1951 Flag of Georgia SSR Red, with the Georgian characters სსსრ (SSSR) in gold in the canton.
1937–1940 Flag of Georgia SSR Red, with the Georgian characters საქართველოს სსრ (Sakartvelos SSR) in gold in the canton.
1921–1937 Flag of Georgia SSR Red, with the Cyrillic characters ССРГ (SSRG) in the canton.
1922–1936 Flag of the Transcaucasian SFSR
1918–1921 Flag of the Democratic Republic of Georgia Ratio: 1:2
1918 Flag of the Transcaucasian Federation
1762-1801 Flag of the Kingdom of Kartli-Kakheti
Flag of the Georgian Empire Used during the reign of King Tamar.
Flag of the Kingdom of Georgia Used during the reign of David the Builder.
1008-1490 Flag of the Kingdom of Georgia
778–1008 and 1260–1810 Flag of the Georgian Kingdom of Egrisi-Abkhazia and Kingdom of Imereti
449-522 and 888–1008 Flag of the Kingdom of Iberia during Vakhtang I and flag of Principality of Tao-Klarjeti

Historical Flags of Georgian States[edit]

Flag Date Use Description
1266–1625 Flag of the Samtskhe-Saatabago or Principality of Meskheti
1460s–1829 Flag (Coat of Arms) of the Principality of Guria
1463–1858 Flag (Coat of Arms) of the Principality of Svaneti
1463–1570s Flag (Coat of Arms) of the Principality of Abkhazia
1557–1867 Flag of the Principality of Mingrelia
1466–1762 Flag (Coat of Arms) of the Kingdom of Kartli
1463 — 1810 Flag (Coat of Arms) of the Kingdom of Imereti This flag was official until annexation by Russian Empire
1466 — 1762 Flag of the Kingdom of Kakheti This flag was official until Kingdom of Kakheti and Kingdom of Kartli unified into Kingdom of Kartli-Kakheti
